title: Set up OAuth2 in Thunderbird to download messages from https://outlook.live.com/mail/?
content:
I'm runnning Thunderbird 128.0.1esr (64-bit) and use it to download email messages from an outlook.live.com server.

For many weeks now, Microsoft has been sending this warning to my old hotmail accounts: "To help keep your account secure, Microsoft will no longer support the use of third-party email and calendar apps which ask you to sign in with only your Microsoft Account username and password. To keep you safe you will need to use a mail or calendar app which supports Microsoft’s modern authentication methods. If you do not act, your third-party email apps will no longer be able to access your Outlook.com, Hotmail or Live.com email address on September 16th."

I tried switching the POP server setting on one of my hotmail accounts from "Normal password" to OAuth2, but then Thunderbird would stall when I to download mail. So I've had to switch Thunderbird back to "Normal password."

I've asked for help at the Mozillazine Thunderbird forum, but so far no one has been able to figure out a solution to this problem. So I'm hoping to find help here.
creator: clueless.in.seattle1

title: Incorrect threading
content: Thunderbird clumps together emails in a string, which results in several annoying things. a) You can't immediately see who the latest email is from. b) When you open the string all the emails open up and you then have to close them one by one, which wastes time. c) Thunderbird sometimes clumps unrelated emails into a string, making it hard to track responses and find original attachments to earlier emails wrongly associated. I find all this completely useless and preferred when I could sort by subject line, sender or date. Sooo much easier! How can I go back to that?

title: Not getting messages on Thunderbird for my encrypted email account
content: Good morning- my name is Paul B. I use Thunderbird for my email box sender and receiver. For the last few days I am not getting my encrypted Mailfence messages on Thunderbird but they are coming through on my cell phone. I have a backup non-encrypted email on Thunderbird and it is working find sending and receiving. I checked Thunderbird and it said I needed to verify/update my Open PGP Key which I did. It offered the option of setting up a new Open PGP Key or verify the old one. I verified the old one and got a Thunderbird response that this was verified with them yesterday but I still am not getting Mailfence emails on Thunderbird.I sent a message from my wife's computer to my Mailfence account and received it on my cell phone but not on my laptop/Thunderbird site this morning. Any suggestions? Thank you - Paul B.

title: Backup / Restore IMAP accounts to new host
content:
Hello,

I need to transfer all e-mail accounts of a domain to a new E-mail host. My idea is to configure a thunderbird client in a server with all domain e-mail accounts in order to back up then. When I switch the domain to the new E-mail host, the idea is to use this backup to populate the new accounts on this host.

In order to test my idea, I did the follow steps:

1) Create a new e-mail account 2) Configured Thunderbird with this account (IMAP) and populate it with some messages and folders. 3) Did the Backup of thunderbird account profile. 4) Closed the Thunderbird 5) I’ve deleted the account a created it again with the same credentials, in order to simulate the account on a new host. 6) Then I Opened Thunderbird and, after synchronize the account, restore the profile.

The problem: As the message sync is done from the host to the client (Thunderbird), All messages restored are deleted. This because the new account have no messages in the host.

Question: Is there a way to use thunderbird to restore all messages of the profile to a new account?

I will need to do this for the almost 90 e-mails accounts of the domain. Anyone know a (free) tool that can do this?

Best Regards,

Marcelo
creator: movnet

title: where is .ics attachment? calendar invitation file missing from email
content: Hi, This is a problem that has been occurring with Thunderbird for a while now. I thought I'd previously found lots of posts on this topic and I wanted to check them but I can't see to find them now. I use Thunderbird for my work email account. I receive invitations to Teams meetings through email. When I use Outlook on my phone I can see an attached .ics file. When I use the web based email client provided by my ISP I can see an attached .ics file. When I use Thunderbird there's a message that says: "No writable calendars are configured for invitations, please check the calendar properties." and it claims there are no attachments. I don't care if it can't find a writable calendar, I want to download the .ics file. Where is the .ics file? I can download it from the other two clients and then import it into Thunderbird calendar fine. But that's a complete pain in the neck, having to log into a seperate email client to do that. If it's attached file, as the other two clients treat it as, why won't Thunderbird let me download it? Windows 10 Thunderbird 115.13.0 (64-bit)
